title: Factor the Perfect Square

title: Factor the Perfect Square
text: In this case, we can see that $$n^2-10n+25$$ as $${\left(a x\right)}^2-2a b x+b^2={\left(ax-b\right)}^2$$ where $$ax=n$$ and $$b=5$$. We can factor $$n^2-10n+25$$ as $${\left(n+5\right)}^2$$.
speech: In this case, we can see that  n squared minus 10 n plus, 25  as , parentheses a x  squared minus, 2 a b x, plus b squared is equal to parentheses, a x minus b,  squared  where  a x is equal to n  and  b, is equal to 5 . We can factor  n squared, minus 10 n plus 25  as , parentheses n plus 5,  squared .

title: Rewrite the Equation
speech: We can rewrite  n squared minus 10 n plus 25 is equal to 16  as , parentheses n minus 5,  squared is equal to 16 .

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $${\left(n-5\right)}^2=16$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$n-5=-4$$ or $$n-5=4$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$n^2-10n+25=16$$ has two solutions which are $$n=1$$ and $$n=9$$.
